name: Hotel delle Muse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here when we visited Rome towards the end of March 2011 and found it to be a great experience, the hotel was clean and the staff were very helpful with all of our needs.
reviews.title: Great little getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is out of town but after walking miles each day we were happy to step away from it all and the hotel location allowed us to do that, the number 360 bus goes by the hotel every 15 minutes or so which will take you into the city centre as will a short walk take you to the number 19 tram that will take you over to Vatican City.
reviews.title: A hotel with everything you need - with great people!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed in the hotel to eat every evening and the food was really good and not overpriced, a bottle of chianti was €9 and the main courses were €7 with potatoes and vegetables being extra, their beef in green pepper sauce was gorgeous and the 2 waiting staff were both entertaining and charming.
reviews.title: A nice Hotel with a friendly atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One last thing to mention was the hotel lift, if my shoulders were another 3 inches wider then I wouldn't be able to fit in their sideways! We had a good laugh about it which just added to the experience and I'd happily recommend this hotel to anyone going.
reviews.title: A Gem of a Little Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Delle Muse was a very nice hotel with all comfort you can expect. The people working there are very friendly and helpful. It is outside the main center area, however within 30 minutes walk you were already close to the center and the busses were driving very frequently! Also the hotel had a nice restaurant where you can taste the Italian delicacies :)
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay with Wonderful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: From arrival to departure all the hotel staff were happy, very helpful and genuinely seemed pleased and interested in making my stay as enjoyable as possible.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel with friendly, helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was pleasantly warm, clean and the bed comfortable. The same applies to the bathroom facilities.
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free internet was a bonus and had reasonably consistent speeds.
reviews.title: The nicest people!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was in buffet format, well presented and delicious. The evening meals were also very delicious and not ridiculously expensive.
reviews.title: Amazing, helpful, friendly staff and wonderful area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The only negative thing was the location which to be fair isn't really a big deal. If you intend to use this hotel as a base to spend a lot of time touring around Rome you will need to walk for 30-35 minutes to get to the nearest Metro. If you don't want to walk there is a bus and tram service on the main road about 10 minutes away. I personally liked the location in general as it was in a pleasant, quiet road away from the traffic and noise. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I look forward to staying here the next time I'm in Rome.
reviews.title: A pleasant relief from the Hectic City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I liked the hotel from the moment I got there. Check-in was done in just a couple of minutes. I can't add a lot to the prior reviews without repeating the same information. I found it was a good value, no unwelcome surprises. The only warning I would give is skip the car service they promote for the airport. It's nearly $100 US to do a one way trip (they quote a price that does not include luggage). We used airportshuttle.it., which took us to the airport for $31 Euro (2 people) and we had to leave at 4AM.
reviews.title: Very good stay. Very happy with the place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Wi Fi and computers in the lobby helped us keep Facebook pictures current!
reviews.title: Excellent choice for extended stay traveler on a budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area is somewhat residential, but tucked away are several pizzerias, and one a couple of blocks away, serves beer and the locals from the area seem to congregate there to socialze. Nice people. There is also a market about 4 blocks down the street where you can buy Italian coffee and wine for under two Euros. They had Italian candy as well. We found great gifts to bring back there at great prices. The area has more to offer than it appears at first glance, as while it is nice, it seems to be mostly residential.
reviews.title: Felt Like Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Delle Muse was a wonderful hotel located in a great section of Parioli. This small town had everything you needed in walking distance shops food etc...
reviews.title: Hotel delle Muse made Rome a comfortable trip !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel itself was nice and the staff there was wonderful. They helped me with directions and instructions on the best things to do in Rome. It took me some time to get used to the iron roll up gates on the windows and the small compact room but this is customary there in most cases.
reviews.title: CHarming hotel. Super staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In a quiet,residential area but easy to get to all Rome attractions using cheap local bus to connect with centre where you can walk to/take metro to areas you wish to visit. Very handy (20 min walk) to Stadio Flaminio for Rugby enthusiasts.
reviews.title: Very friendly,clean & excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011
reviews.text: Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms are of adequate size and very clean.Hotel restaurant offers good quality food from extensive menu and is extremely good value. We decided to take all our meals at hotel after dining there the first night !
reviews.title: Liked it so much we stayed again, already!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010
reviews.text: Cannot speak too highly and would not hesitate to recommend to family & friends
reviews.title: Hotel Delle Muse is to me Home away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: David Bull.Leicester,England
reviews.title: Cosy, Clean, Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My mom and I stayed in room 250--awesome room with really nice balcony overlooking the courtyard...no street noise--for a 4 days. It isn't the biggest room in the world but was fine with us considering we left every morning around 10 and only returned around 7 or 8 that night. Only one English tv channel, Fox News...but at least you'll have an idea of what's going on in the States. There is free wi-fi, just get the password at reception. Also, these guys are great because they let us check-in early on our return visit, and there wasn't any hassle--we actually left our luggage and then walked down to Saturno to get some awesome food (hotel restaurant wasn't open yet). Another huge thing is that Claudio ( I think that's his name) speaks Italian, English, German, and French and everyone else seems pretty multi-lingual as well--if you're worried about not being understood don't even worry it! On our return we were put in room 121 which was HUGE with a huge patio...definitely a room for in the spring when everything is blooming! It was really nice but the shower was smaller than in 250 but still big enough for me.
reviews.title: A hidden gem

description: The three star Hotel delle Muse is located in a very quite and green residential area called Parioli which is traditionally considered the most elegant part of Rome.All our 57 rooms have: en suite WC with shower, hairdryer, Color LCD 21’satellite TV, direct dial telephone, air conditioning/heater, Internet ADSL Cable Connection (free of charge)Internet Wi.FI Connection (free of charge) ,Electronic Safe.On the premises are elevator, safe, bar and restaurant where genuine and varied food is served either in the dining rooms or in the large garden during the summer months.Free Luggage Room. L’Hotel Delle Muse*** è situato nel quartiere Parioli , una zona verde e tranquilla che è per tradizione la più elegante di Roma.Tutte le nostre camere offrono: Bagno in camera con doccia , Asciugacapelli , Telefono diretto, Televisore LCD 21’’ con canali satellitari e Sky, Connessione Internet ADSL via cavo gratuita , Connessione Internet Wi.Fi gratuita , Aria Condizionata/Riscaldamento , Cassaforte Elettronica.Inoltre l’Hotel è provvisto di ascensore , cassette di sicurezza, servizio Bar e di Ristorante nel quale è possibile gustare svariati piatti genuini sia nei saloni interni che nell’ampio giardino durante i mesi estivi.
